thread.title: Ford Motor Co warns Trump metal tariffs may hike commodity prices

title: Ford Motor Co warns Trump metal tariffs may hike commodity prices
text: March 2, 2018 / 8:49 PM / Updated 12 minutes ago Ford Motor Co warns Trump metal tariffs may hike commodity prices David Shepardson 1 Min Read WASHINGTON, March 2 (Reuters) - Ford Motor Co said on Friday that U.S. President Donald Trump’s announced steel and aluminum tariffs could boost domestic commodity prices and harm the“competitiveness of American manufacturers.” In a statement, Ford noted the tariffs’ impact even though the automaker buys“the vast majority of its steel and aluminum for U.S. production in the U.S.” In January, Ford warned that higher prices for metals such as aluminum and steel would be a significant drag on earnings this year. (Reporting by David Shepardson; editing by Grant McCool)
